results.title: Les Orgueilleux = the Proud Ones
results.brief_description:
Well-bred Nelly and down-and-out doctor Georges cross paths in Vera Cruz, Mexico, in this absorbing tale of love, religion, and the effects of a deadly plague on the impoverished populace.

Credits: Producer, Louis Wipf ; director, Yves Allegret ; writers, Yves Allegret, Jean Aurenche, Jean Clouzot ; photography, Alex Phillips ; music, Paul Misraki ; sound, William-Robert Sivel ; stills photographer, Raymond Voinquel.
Cast: Michele Morgan, Gerard Philipe, Michele Cordoue, Carlos Lopez, Victor, Manuel Mendoza.

results.title: Les Olympiens = the Olympians
results.brief_description:
Vidocq has joined a pirate ship transporting 300 barrels of stolen rum. A wounded soldier gives Vidocq his ID papers and our man leaps at the chance to come back to France and reunite with Annette. Shortly after his arrival at the army barracks, Vidocq receives a mysterious invitation to attend a secret meeting of The Olympians Society.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Michel Charrel, Albert Dagnant, Maurice Garrel, Fred Personne.

results.title: Les Nouveaux Realistes
results.creator_credit: Michele Arnaud, Reiner Moritz and Adrian Maben
results.brief_description:
Profile of a group of artists trying to bring into their art the reality of urban and industrial landscapes. They include: Yves Klein, Arman, Cesar, Christo, Deschamps, Dufrene, Hains, Tinguely, Nikki de Saint Phalle.

Credits: Producers, Michele Arnaud, Reiner Moritz ; director, Adrian Maben.

results.title: Les Noces rouges = Blood wedding
results.creator_credit: Les Films de la Boetie, Canaria Films, Andre Genoves and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description:
This French thriller was banned at the time of its release ostensibly because it resembled a true murder case but pundits claimed it message operated too closely as a parable for the French elections being held at the time. Lucienne Delamare, the mayor of a small town in the Loire Valley discovers that his wife is having an affair with his deputy, and decides to blackmail the latter into going along with a crooked property deal. The scheme is to redevelop a high-rise dwelling and factory for workers, but Lucienne will be the principal beneficiary. ‘Les Noces Rouge’ is another variation on Chabrol’s pet theme of infidelity leading to murder and is as elegant and cool as one expects from a director secure in his subject. A darkly comic tale of revenge, greed and petty corruption.

Credits: Producer, Andre Genoves ; director, writer, Claude Chabrol ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen ; editing, Jacques Gaillard, Monique Gaillard.
Cast: Michel Piccoli, Stephan Audran, Clotilde Joano, Eliana De Santis, Ermanno Casanova.

results.title: Les Nations S'affirment
results.brief_description:
This episode deals with the slow movement of affirmation of regional styles as a sign of resistance against the ‘French gothic’. Sicily is a prime example of a country where the confluence of the Hellenic, Islamic and Latin inflences gives birth to a singular style, epitomized by the cathedral of Montreale (near Palermo). In Italy, Frederic II Hohenstauffen moves to reject both the Islamic and Byzantine influence as well as that of the French gothic. The Cathedral in Betonto (Italy) bears the strong influence of the Carolingian style in evidence in the Palatine chapel of Aachen (Germany).

Credits: Director, Roland Darbois ; writers, Roger Stephane, Roland Darbois, photography, Roland Dantigny.
Cast: Narrated by Georges Duby.

results.title: Les Mysteres de Paris = the Mysteries of Paris
results.brief_description:
Rodolphe de Sombreuil runs over a poor man in the street and promises he will look after his young daughter. Sombreuil disguises himself as a working-class man and goes looking for Fleur de Marie who has been kidnapped by shady underworld characters. He is appalled by the squalor in which people live in the depressing working class slums.

Credits: Producer, Paul Cadeac ; director, Andre Hunebelle ; writer, Jean Halain ; photography, Marcel Grignon ; music, Jean Marion.
Cast: Jean Marais, Dany Robin, Raymond Pellegrin, Jill Hayworth, Pierre Mondy, Madeleine Barbulee, Paulette Dubost, Jean Le Poulain, Noel Roquevert.

results.title: Les Mysteres de Paris (TV Version) = the Mysteries of Paris
results.brief_description:
This version of Sue’s novel was originally conceived as a live-to-air production. Rodolphe de Sombreuil runs over a poor man in the streets and promises he will look after his young daughter. Sombreuil disguises himself as a working-class man and goes looking for Fleur de Marie who has been kidnapped by shady underworld characters. He is appalled by the squalor in which people live in the depressing working class slums.

Credits: Director, Marcel Cravenne ; writers, Claude Santelli ; photography, Maurice Barry ; music, Maurice Jarre.

results.title: Les Mistons = the Brats
results.brief_description:
The awakening sexuality of a group of boys during a summer in Nimes is focused on Bernadette, the sister of one of them, and her short-lived love affair with Gerard, a physical education teacher. The blend of sensuality and nostalgia, tenderness and irony recalls Renoir, especially ‘Partie de Campagne’. The voice-over narration ensures that we see Bernadette - the first of Truffaut’s succession of inacessible women - through the eyes of the boys.

Credits: Producer, Robert Lachenay ; director, Francois Truffaut ; photography, Jean Malige ; music, Maurice Leroux
Cast: Gerard Blain, Bernadette Lafont, Michel Francois [naration].

results.title: Les Miserables: Stage By Stage
results.creator_credit: Telstar Independent Programs, Martin Cox, Trevor Nunn and John Caird
results.brief_description: This film follows the development of the musical “Les Miserables” which has become a triumph the world over. When it opened in London in October 1985, at the Barbican Theatre, it opened to mixed reviews, but went on to silence the critics and is now one of the most successful musical shows of all time. “Les Miserables” is either in production or development in over seventy cities of the world. The success continues. A symphonic recording of the complete score is being released worldwide and a film version of the musical is in development. Using performance footage from the London, Oslo, Budapest and Viennese productions, this program celebrates this phenomenal success and discusses its progress with its writers, directors and producers.

results.title: Les Miserables (TV Version)
results.brief_description:
Imprisoned for stealing a loaf of bread, Jean Valjean’s life is transformed by an act of forgiveness. He becomes the respected mayor of the poor town of Vigau and transforms it into a thriving community. He also falls in love with one of Vigau’s most pitiful, poverty-stricken residents, the beautiful Fantine, and devotes himself to her care.

Credits: Director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Marcel Bluwal ; photography, Andre Bac.
Cast: Bernard Fresson, Micha Bayard, Georges Geret, Nicole Jamet, Francois Marthouret, Alain Mottet.
